title: Washington State Department of Ecology, Marine Oil Spill Booming Strategies, Washington, 2003

features.Strategy_I: Enclose science center pier, protect water intakes.
features.Site_Acces: Road access to Science Center, boat ramp adjacent to Science Center
features.Location: Port Townsend Marine Science Center  JEF0611
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Protect Science Center pier
features.Resources_: Science Center marine life
features.Staging_Ar: Science Center Pier

features.Strategy_I: Place boom at outlet to small marsh area, boom needs to be tended to deflect the oil away from the marsh opening depending on the direction of the current in the canal.
features.Site_Acces: By boat in canal; also day park 1/4 mile walk on Marrowstone Island Road.
features.Location: Oak Bay - tidal marsh on SE side of Port Townsend Canal  JEF0425
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Deflection - keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh, seabird and waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Day park off Marrowstone Island Road.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy three overlapping booms 1000' long each to deflect the oil past the entrance to the harbor.  Current through the harbor entrance is very strong.  Likely to work only with 12" fast water boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Fort Flagler or Mystery Bay
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil out of harbor
features.Resources_: Fish & wildlife resources in Kilisut Harbor.  Marine mammal haulout.
features.Staging_Ar: Fort Flagler State Park or Mystery Bay Boat Ramp

features.Strategy_I: Deploy three overlapping booms 1000' long each to deflect the oil past the entrance to the harbor.  Current through the harbor entrance is very strong.  Likely to work only with 12" fast water boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Fort Flagler or Mystery Bay
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil out of harbor
features.Resources_: Fish & wildlife resources in Kilisut Harbor.  Marine mammal haulout.
features.Staging_Ar: Fort Flagler State Park or Mystery Bay Boat Ramp

features.Strategy_I: Deploy three overlapping booms 1000' long each to deflect the oil past the entrance to the harbor.  Current through the harbor entrance is very strong.  Likely to work only with 12" fast water boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Fort Flagler or Mystery Bay
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil out of harbor
features.Resources_: Fish & wildlife resources in Kilisut Harbor.  Marine mammal haulout.
features.Staging_Ar: Fort Flagler State Park or Mystery Bay Boat Ramp

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from south end of sand spit at south entrance to the harbor to deflect oil away from entrance.  Current through the entrance is very strong.  May only work with 12" fast water boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Fort Flagler or Mystery Bay
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil out of harbor
features.Resources_: Fish & wildlife resources in Kilisut Harbor.  Marine mammal haulout.
features.Staging_Ar: Fort Flagler State Park or Mystery Bay Boat Ramp

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from shore on Indian Island at angle to the west.  Boom angle will need to be sharp due to strong current through entrance.  Deploy boom at position where vac truck access is possible for shore-side collection.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Fort Flagler or Mystery Bay.  Shoreline is U.S. Navy property, need permission for access.
features.Response_S: Collection - Keep oil out of harbor
features.Resources_: Fish & wildlife resources in Kilisut Harbor.  Marine mammal haulout.
features.Staging_Ar: Fort Flagler State Park or Mystery Bay Boat Ramp

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at entrance to salt marsh on N.E. shore.
features.Site_Acces: By land from Mystery Bay State Park, or by boat from ramp at park.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh,  waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Mystery Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from east shore of bay at an angle to the west shore for collection.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at Mystery Bay State Park.
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ deflection/ collection - Keep oil out of marsh/ mud flats.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh,  waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Mystery Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at entrance to salt marsh.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at Mystery Bay State Park.
features.Location: Bishops Point - east shore of Indian Island  JEF0524
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh on point.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh,  waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Mystery Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Place at northern most edge of salt marsh - low tide deployment.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from ramp at Mystery Bay State Park.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh; waterfowl concentrations; marine mammal haulout; sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Mystery Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Close tide gates; place boom across outlets on north side of road if gates can't be closed.  Could also use plywood and sand bags to close off the culvert.
features.Site_Acces: Road access at Highway 116.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh; waterfowl concentrations; marine mammal haulout; sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Mystery Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Place boom around culvert or use plywood to prevent oil from flowing into the lake.  High tide strategy only.
features.Site_Acces: Road access at Highway 20.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of lake.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Fort Casey State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at position where vac truck access is possible for shore-side collection.
features.Site_Acces: Port Townsend Marina or Fort Worden State Park
features.Location: Beach north of Point Hudson  JEF0604
features.Response_S: Deflection/ collection - Keep oil from moving into Port Townsend
features.Resources_: Protect waterfowl and seabird concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Fort Worden State Park

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration across the entrance to the lake.  If current through the entrance is too high for boom, block entrance with sand bags as an alternative.  Use of sand bags will require an emergency HPA permit from WDFW.  Position of
features.Site_Acces: Road access from Highway 525, small road north of lake leads to beach.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of wetlands.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Fort Casey State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from west side of channel into the bay to shore south of gravel barge slips, and divert oil into cove for barge slips and collect with vac trucks.
features.Site_Acces: Boat ramp at south end of Mats Mats Bay.
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ diversion/ collection - Keep oil out of bay.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the boat ramp at south end of Mats Mats Bay.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across entrance to marsh.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Port Ludlow Marina.
features.Location: Port Ludlow tidal marsh - SE corner of bay  JEF0358
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations, marsh habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port Ludlow Marina  (JEF0370).

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across inlet mouth.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Port Ludlow Marina.
features.Location: Port Ludlow mud flats - NW corner of bay  JEF0364
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of mud flats.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port Ludlow Marina  (JEF0370).

features.Strategy_I: Place 2 chevrons (500' each leg) in front of E and W low points on the spit.  String 2000' between the chevrons.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at the Hood Canal Bridge, possible access by ATV.
features.Location: Bywater Bay (spit on north end)  JEF0331
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Diversion - Keep oil out of bay.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, eelgrass, shellfish and baitfish
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the boat ramp north of Hood Canal bridge on west shore  (JEF0311).

features.Strategy_I: Place chevron at mouth of bay, 1000' west leg, 1500' east leg.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at the Hood Canal Bridge, possible access by ATV.
features.Location: Bywater Bay at Hood Head  JEF0330
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of bay.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, eelgrass, shellfish and baitfish
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the boat ramp north of Hood Canal bridge on west shore  (JEF0311).

features.Strategy_I: Place chevron at mouth of bay, 1000' west leg, 1500' east leg.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at the Hood Canal Bridge, possible access by ATV.
features.Location: Bywater Bay at Hood Head  JEF0330
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of bay.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, eelgrass, shellfish and baitfish
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the boat ramp north of Hood Canal bridge on west shore  (JEF0311).

features.Strategy_I: Angle boom behind the chevron from Hood Head to the back of bay, collect any entrained oil in the NW corner of bay.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at the Hood Canal Bridge, possible access by ATV.
features.Location: Bywater Bay at Hood Head  JEF0330
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Deflect oil to west side of bay for collection.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, eelgrass, shellfish and baitfish
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the boat ramp north of Hood Canal bridge on west shore  (JEF0311).

features.Strategy_I: Place 200' between Bywater bay and small bay/ mud flats to the west.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at the Hood Canal Bridge, possible access by ATV.
features.Location: Bywater Bay at Hood Head  JEF0330
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of bay/ mud flats.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, eelgrass, shellfish and baitfish
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the boat ramp north of Hood Canal bridge on west shore  (JEF0311).

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across entrance to marsh at SE corner of spit.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from ramp at park.
features.Location: Northspit - tidal marsh south of Foulweather Bluff  KIT0385
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations, marsh habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Salsbury Point County Park  (KIT0435).

features.Strategy_I: Angle boom from west side of lagoon entrance to a collection point on the east shore.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from ramp at Dave Mackie County Park (high tide only).
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ diversion/ collection - Keep oil out of lagoon.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations; sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Dave Mackie County Park  (ISL0508).

features.Strategy_I: Set up series of overlapping deflection booms parallel to shore north of park.  Old pilings along the shore may help hold the boom in place.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Port Townsend Marina.
features.Location: Old Port Townsend State Park  JEF0588
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil away from park.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species; significant smelt spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at the park or from Port Townsend.

features.Strategy_I: Set up series of overlapping deflection booms parallel to shore north of park.  Old pilings along the shore may help hold the boom in place.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Port Townsend Marina.
features.Location: Old Port Townsend State Park  JEF0588
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil away from park.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species; significant smelt spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at the park or from Port Townsend.

features.Strategy_I: Set up series of overlapping deflection booms parallel to shore north of park.  Old pilings along the shore may help hold the boom in place.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Port Townsend Marina.
features.Location: Old Port Townsend State Park  JEF0588
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil away from park.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species; significant smelt spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at the park or from Port Townsend.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across entrance to marsh at west end, will need a jon boat.
features.Site_Acces: Road access off road to Deer Lagoon from Bay View Road.
features.Location: Tidal marsh southeast of Deer Lagoon  ISL0496
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Dave Mackie County Park  (ISL0508).

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from the north end of the residential area on the sand spit at the Cultus Bay marina (private) and run the boom directly north to the nearest shoreline where there is access for vac trucks to set up a collection point.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Possession ramp or Mukilteo State Park.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of inner bay.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl and shorebird concentrations; sensitive nesting species
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Possession boat ramp parking lot (ISL0003) or the Mukilteo State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Place boom across entrance to marsh area south of the spit.  Can be deployed from land.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Port Townsend.  Vehicle access from north side of spit.
features.Location: Kala Point - Marsh, south side  JEF0579
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Protect sensitive marsh habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Port Townsend.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle across the creek mouth.  Can be deployed from land with a jon boat.
features.Site_Acces: Vehicle access from the Evergreen Logging Company on the south side of the creek.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creek.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentration, salmonids.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Evergreen Logging Company on the south side of the creek.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from west side of Skunk Island directly west to shoreline on sand spit.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Port Hadlock ramp, or from Port Townsend.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentration, sensitive marsh
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Port Hadlock.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from southeast side of Skunk Island directly south to shoreline west of marina.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Port Hadlock ramp, or from Port Townsend.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentration, sensitive marsh
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Port Hadlock.

features.Strategy_I: Place boom along entrance to backwater area adjacent to west side of dike/jetty.  Access requires the use of a jon boat.
features.Site_Acces: Oak Bay Co. Park ramp/road, ramp may be blocked by drift logs.
features.Location: Oak Bay - tidal marsh on SW side of Port Townsend Canal  JEF0421
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of wetlands.
features.Resources_: Wetland habitat, seabird and waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Oak Bay Co. Park.

features.Strategy_I: Place boom at marsh outlet south of road, will need a jon boat at high tide.
features.Site_Acces: By land at day park off Marrowstone Island Road, or by water.
features.Location: Oak Bay - tidal marsh on SE side of Port Townsend Canal  JEF0426
features.Response_S: Exclusion - keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Salicornia salt marsh, seabird and waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Day park off Marrowstone Island Road.

features.Strategy_I: Shut tide gates if the threat of oiling exists.  Tide gate is 0.3 mile south of Dayton St., off gravel road along RR tracks.  Tide gate has chain/lock - key at Edmonds Public Works 425-771-0235 (also can be cut).
features.Site_Acces: Edmonds Marina
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of wildlife sanctuary
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, Harbor Seals, California Sea Lions
features.Staging_Ar: Edmonds Marina

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration from the Pt. Monroe sand spit to the shoreline to the south to close off the entrance to the lagoon.
features.Site_Acces: Boat launch at Fay Bainbridge State Park; private and public access near area for vehicles
features.Response_S: Diversion / Collection - Keep oil out of the lagoon.
features.Resources_: Protect fish & wildlife resources
features.Staging_Ar: Fay Bainbridge State Park (boat launch)

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle across the entrance of Port Madison to divert oil to the east shore near the road for collection.
features.Site_Acces: Boat launch at Fay Bainbridge State Park; private and public access for vehicles
features.Response_S: Deflection / Collection - Prevent oil from entering Port Madison
features.Resources_: Protect fish & wildlife resources
features.Staging_Ar: Fay Bainbridge State Park (boat launch)

features.Strategy_I: Close causeway and add 200' of protective boom in front of causeway.
features.Site_Acces: Access by vehicle from downtown Keyport, boat access from Naval Base or fuel dock at Poulsbo
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of lagoon
features.Resources_: Pigeon Guillemots
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Anchor at launch ramp, collect oil between launch ramp and stone rip-rap.  Caution - Pipeline Area.
features.Site_Acces: Vehicle access from downtown Keyport, boat access from Naval Base or Poulsbo fuel dock
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Prevent oil from entering Liberty Bay
features.Resources_: Marine birds, waterfowl, & baitfish spawning beaches
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Anchor at launch ramp, collect oil between launch ramp and stone rip-rap.  Caution - Pipeline Area.
features.Site_Acces: Vehicle access from downtown Keyport, boat access from Naval Base or Poulsbo fuel dock
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Prevent oil from entering Liberty Bay
features.Resources_: Marine birds, waterfowl, & baitfish spawning beaches
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Anchor at launch ramp, collect oil between launch ramp and stone rip-rap.  Caution - Pipeline Area.
features.Site_Acces: Vehicle access from downtown Keyport, boat access from Naval Base or Poulsbo fuel dock
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Prevent oil from entering Liberty Bay
features.Resources_: Marine birds, waterfowl, & baitfish spawning beaches
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Angle north leg toward the east to collect oil in North of bay.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Keyport Marina, Naval Base, fuel dock at Poulsbo
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Divert and collect oil before it can reach Liberty Bay
features.Resources_: Protect fish & wildlife resources in inner Liberty Bay
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Harbor

features.Strategy_I: Locate south leg just West of power lines and East of the house w/ flagpole flying several state flags - Collect oil at small private ramp (caution pipeline area).
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Keyport Marina, Naval Base, fuel dock at Poulsbo
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Divert and collect oil before it can reach Liberty Bay
features.Resources_: Protect fish & wildlife resources in inner Liberty Bay
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Harbor

features.Strategy_I: Place boom across East inlet.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Brownsville Marina, road access at bridge
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering bay
features.Resources_: Protect herring spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Place booms in chevron configuration across mouth of bay; anchor to pilings. Large anchor at apex.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Brownsville Marina, road access at bridge
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering bay
features.Resources_: Protect herring spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Extend boom along & past existing pier - collect at pier.  Boom reel already at end of pier.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Edmonds Marina
features.Response_S: Collection
features.Resources_: Kelp beds to north; sensitive resources north and south
features.Staging_Ar: Edmonds Marina; Richmond Beach

features.Strategy_I: Roving barriers along shore as needed - Need to make best guess as to where oil will landfall, protect most likely landfall areas.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Brownsville Marina, road access at bridge
features.Boom_More: As much boom as is available to protect as much shoreline as possible
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from reaching shore
features.Boom_Lengt: As much boom as is available to protect as much shoreline as possible
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species & smelt spawning beach
features.Staging_Ar: Keyport Naval Base

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration on the east side of the bridge.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Brownsville marina, road access at bridge
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering Burke Bay
features.Resources_: Blue heron rookery on South shore and wetlands in bay
features.Staging_Ar: Brownsville Marina

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration across the entrance to the bay.
features.Site_Acces: Boat launch at Brownsville, shoreline on both sides private
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Fletcher Bay
features.Resources_: Protect fish & wildlife resources
features.Staging_Ar: Vessel and/or Brownsville

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration across mouth of the creek.
features.Site_Acces: Road access via Illahee Rd
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creek
features.Resources_: Waterfowl & salmonids
features.Staging_Ar: Illahee State Park

features.Strategy_I: Anchor boom from SE shore to mooring buoys then to dock and into NE shore at the bulkhead.
features.Site_Acces: Illahee State Park boat launch
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil off shoreline
features.Resources_: State Park beaches
features.Staging_Ar: Illahee State Park

features.Strategy_I: Close off mouth to Oyster Bay w/ 250' sections anchored to boulders, trees & pilings
features.Site_Acces: Boat access
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of bays
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, smelt and sand lance spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Bremerton Naval Hospital (helo pad)

features.Strategy_I: Place chevron w/ apex to the North - Need land and (4) 70lb anchors.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of bay
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, smelt and sand lance spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Bremerton Naval Hospital (helo pad)

features.Strategy_I: Form chevron at mouth of Ostrich Bay anchored to dock at Elwood Pt. and to East shore.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of bays
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, smelt and sand lance spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Bremerton Naval Hospital (helo pad)

features.Strategy_I: Place boom across the mouth of Chico Creek.
features.Site_Acces: Road access via Hwy 3
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering creek
features.Resources_: Salmon
features.Staging_Ar: Bremerton Naval Hospital (helo pad)

features.Strategy_I: Close off flat in front of creek;  High water deploy from boat, Low water from road.
features.Site_Acces: Boat and vehicle from Silverdale, Traceyton Beach Rd goes over mouth of creek
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering creek estuary
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Silverdale

features.Strategy_I: High tide only - no threat otherwise.  Place weir dam or other partial dam at culverts to prevent oil/tidal water from entering but allowing creek flow out.  Will need sandbags, cement, plywood, etc.  Boom as last resort.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Edmonds or Shilshole Bay; land access possible
features.Boom_More: 100' - increase to  500' at low water &/or high creek flow
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering creek mouth
features.Boom_Lengt: 100' - increase to  500' at low water &/or high creek flow
features.Resources_: Protect salmon and Carkeek watershed program area
features.Staging_Ar: Richmond Beach park parking lot

features.Strategy_I: Close off small lagoon to SE of Clear Creek.
features.Site_Acces: Boat from Silverdale
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering lagoon
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations; wetlands
features.Staging_Ar: Silverdale

features.Strategy_I: Close off flat in front of creek (two culverts where road crosses creek)  High water = deploy from boat; Low water = from road.
features.Site_Acces: Boat and vehicle from Silverdale, Bucklin Hill Rd goes over Clear Creek
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering creek estuary
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations; wetlands upstream
features.Staging_Ar: Silverdale

features.Strategy_I: Anchor to cement pilings under ferry terminal; run boom out at a SW angle.  Deflect oil into cement pocket next to shipyard property - Collect w/ vac truck.  Note - notify ferry control tower to have captains come in and out on a slow bell.
features.Site_Acces: Access by vehicle and vessel from the shipyard, by ship from the Bremerton Yacht Club
features.Response_S: Deflection / Collection - Prevent oil from going up Dyes Inlet
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Bremerton Naval Shipyard & Ferry dock parking lot

features.Strategy_I: Use shore anchor at high tide. Use pilings to anchor boom from west end of PSNS; extend out to anchor system or tend with boat.
features.Site_Acces: Naval shipyard, Bremerton Yacht Club, Lyons Park, Downtown City Park.
features.Response_S: Deflection - Deflect oil from entering the head of Sinclair Inlet
features.Resources_: Waterfowl, shorebird & seabird concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Bremerton Naval Shipyard - has boom to deploy from their waterfront.

features.Strategy_I: Close off mouth of creek - stake boom to the flat; tide condition dependent  - Shallow deploy from road.
features.Site_Acces: Port Orchard Marina, Bremerton Yacht Club, road access to the site
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creek
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Bay Ford - Port Orchard Marina

features.Strategy_I: Anchor boom along the east edge of marina dock and extend out at angle toward reflector markers.  Collect at dock with vac trucks.
features.Site_Acces: Port Orchard Marina, Bremerton Yacht Club, Naval Shipyard
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Prevent oil from reaching shoreline of Sinclair Inlet
features.Resources_: Waterfowl, shorebird & seabird concentrations
features.Staging_Ar: Port Orchard Marina / Fuel dock

features.Strategy_I: Depending on direction of tidal flow, secure one end of boom to beach on east or west side of point; extend out to deflect away from point.  Boom must be tended by boat.
features.Site_Acces: Port Orchard Marina, Bremerton Yacht Club.  Road access possible to point
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Protect shoreline from oil
features.Resources_: Waterfowl & shorebird concentrations, smelt spawning area
features.Staging_Ar: Port Orchard Marina (fuel)

features.Strategy_I: Apex at outermost log buoy, adjust leg angle to make chevron.
features.Site_Acces: Port Orchard Marina, Bremerton Yacht Club, road access to the site
features.Location: Sinclair Inlet head (south side KIT0079, north side KIT0085)
features.Response_S: Deflection / Collection - Prevent oil from entering inlet
features.Resources_: Waterfowl, shorebird & seabird concentrations - High Priority
features.Staging_Ar: Port Orchard Marina (fuel)

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from North shore to collect oil in eddy.
features.Site_Acces: Road access from Pt. White Dr.
features.Response_S: Collection - Enhance natural collection site
features.Resources_: General protection of fish and wildlife resources
features.Staging_Ar: Manchester Fuel depot

features.Strategy_I: Surround the net pens at the end of the NMFS pier.  Note - does not address adjacent net pens anchored in the mouth of the bay that are privately owned.
features.Site_Acces: Roads on the inside of Clam Bay
features.Location: Clam Bay / NMFS Fish Net Pens KIT0050
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Collection - Prevent oil from reaching NMFS Fish Net Pens.
features.Resources_: Salmon in net pens at NMFS pier (but not the commercial pens).
features.Staging_Ar: Manchester or Bremerton

features.Strategy_I: Close off both culverts where RR crosses creek.
features.Site_Acces: Road access from Shilshole Bay or Edmonds, difficult to reach by land
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Piper Creek estuary
features.Resources_: Protect salmon.  Active public watershed enhancement area.  Note - oil only will enter under extreme tide/flow conditions

features.Resources_: Salmon concentrations and habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: Marina approximately 2 miles upriver.

features.Strategy_I: Angle boom into current to deflect oil to collection point on S. shoreline at sandy beach (tend boom w/tug).  Strategy will work well with a NW wind and a flood tide.
features.Site_Acces: Marina approximately 2 miles upriver / access via sandy spit collection points.
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Deflect oil into waterway for collection.
features.Resources_: Salmon concentrations and habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: Marina approximately 2 miles upriver.

features.Strategy_I: Angle a 400' section SW into the river to deflect oil into a collection site in channel.  Double boom channel with two 200' sections to protect Vancouver Lake.  If necessary, valves can be closed at River Road to prevent oil from entering Vancouver Lake.
features.Site_Acces: Vehicle access from Lower River Road.  Boat access from Vancouver or Portland.
features.Response_S: Deflection/                    Collection - Deflect oil into Flushing Channel for collection.
features.Resources_: Vancouver Lake; down river resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Vancouver, Portland, or the parking area at the west end of the flushing channel.

features.Strategy_I: Angle boom off boat ramp into river; divert oil to collection site.
features.Site_Acces: Marine Park Boat Ramp access via Marine Parkway; good command post area.
features.Location: Marine Park Boat Ramp - upriver from Ryan Point (WA)                    45-36.747'N 122-38.022'W
features.Response_S: Collection - Collect oil in small cove.
features.Resources_: Down river resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Vancouver, Portland, or the boat ramp parking area.

features.Strategy_I: Angle boom upstream, off point just down river of Wintler Park (note - may not need full 500').
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the ramp near Lieser Point.  Vehicle access off of Highway 14.
features.Response_S: Collection - Divert oil to collection sites.
features.Resources_: Resources down river (may be osprey nests in the area).
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Vancouver, Portland, or the boat ramp parking area.

features.Strategy_I: Angle (2) 200' sections upstream, at point up river of Lieser Point, and collect near ramp.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the ramp near Lieser Point.  Vehicle access off of Highway 14.
features.Response_S: Collection - Divert oil to collection sites.
features.Resources_: Resources down river (may be osprey nests in the area).
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Vancouver, Portland, or the boat ramp parking area.

features.Strategy_I: Angle (2) 200' sections upstream, at point up river of Lieser Point, and collect near ramp.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the ramp near Lieser Point.  Vehicle access off of Highway 14.
features.Response_S: Collection - Divert oil to collection sites.
features.Resources_: Resources down river (may be osprey nests in the area).
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Vancouver, Portland, or the boat ramp parking area.

features.Strategy_I: Place two 300' sections across slough entrances just east of I-205 bridge. Use pilings for anchor points. Note - natural eddy will bring oil inside.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access only from Vancouver or Portland.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering slough.
features.Resources_: Critical waterfowl area - high priority.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Portland.

features.Strategy_I: Anchor boom to jetty, & angle into channel.  Collect oil with barges. Culvert in jetty may need to be plugged.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Vancouver or Portland, or vehicles from SE Evergreen Highway.
features.Response_S: Collection - Collect on upriver side of jetty.
features.Resources_: Downstream resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Portland.

features.Strategy_I: Boom off weir (water enters lake only at high water) - may be able to close weir valve.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access only from Vancouver or Portland - contact Oregon Dept. of Fish & Wildlife for weir gate control access.
features.Location: Jewit Lake intake (just downriver from Port of Portland Government Island dock) (OR)                    45-34.915'N 122-30.517'W
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil from entering Jewit Lake.
features.Resources_: Jewit Lake resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Portland.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy 2 lengths of 200' angled into the current to collect oil at the shoreline.
features.Site_Acces: Road down to water from Sentry Gravel Pit.
features.Response_S: Collection - Prevent oil from moving down stream.
features.Resources_: Downstream resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Portland.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy 2 lengths of 200' angled into the current to collect oil at the shoreline.
features.Site_Acces: Road down to water from Sentry Gravel Pit.
features.Response_S: Collection - Prevent oil from moving down stream.
features.Resources_: Downstream resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Portland.

features.Strategy_I: At low flow, it is possible to boom off Camas Slough.  Angle the boom for collection on the south shore of the slough at a road to the water at the west end of the sewage pond on Lady Island.  Angle the boom depending on if the source of the oil is from
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the Port of Camas.  Vehicle access from Highway 14, contact Fort James Camas mill at 360-834-3021.
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Keep oil in or out of the slough depending on source.
features.Resources_: Walleye spawning.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port of Camas, or the Fort James Camas mill.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from the north side of the slough at the Fort James Camas wood mill at a SE angle across the slough.  Collect with vac trucks from the north shore.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the Port of Camas.  Vehicle access from Highway 14, contact Fort James Camas mill at 360-834-3021.
features.Location: Camas Slough - east of the Hwy-14 bridge (WA)                    45-34.782'N 122-25.028'W
features.Response_S: Collection - Prevent oil from moving down stream.
features.Resources_: Downstream resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port of Camas, or the Fort James Camas mill.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the slough as a backup to the Lewis and Clark River strategy.
features.Site_Acces: Access by boat from launch at Yacht  Club near bridge or at Tides Point across from Daggett Point.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.
features.Resources_: Wintering waterfowl, Fort Clatsop National Park, foraging shorebirds and seabirds.
features.Staging_Ar: Port of Astoria, Pier 2.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the slough as a backup to the Lewis and Clark River strategy.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the slough as a backup to the Lewis and Clark River strategy.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.
features.Resources_: Wintering waterfowl, Fort Clatsop National Park, foraging shorebirds and seabirds.

features.Strategy_I: During low flows it is possible to boom off the east end of Camas slough.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the Port of Camas.  Vehicle access from Highway 14, contact Fort James Camas mill at 360-834-3021.
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Keep oil in or out of the slough depending on source.
features.Resources_: Washougal River salmonid stocks; walleye spawning.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port of Camas, or the Fort James Camas mill.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at the bridge to Lady Island.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the Washougal River and Camas Slough.
features.Resources_: Washougal River salmonid stocks.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port of Camas, or the Fort James Camas mill.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from the northeast corner of the west entrance to the Sandy River at an angle to deflect oil moving down the Columbia River back into the main channel.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the Port of Camas.
features.Location: Sandy River - west side of mouth (OR)                    45-34.022'N 122-23.550'W
features.Response_S: Deflection - Keep oil out of river mouth.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat, smelt.

features.Strategy_I: Boom off entrances on the east side of the river mouth.  The position and number of the entrances is variable due to shifting delta sediments and also depends on river flow.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from the Port of Camas.
features.Location: Sandy River - east side of mouth (OR)                    45-33.680'N 122-21.860'W
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Exclusion - Keep oil out of river mouth.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat, smelt.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Port of Camas.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle from the west end of the bridge to the south and east for collection on the east shoreline  This is a working channel so leave boom open until oil seen & put out notice to mariners.
features.Site_Acces: Access by boat from launch at Yacht  Club near bridge or at Tides Point across from Daggett Point.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.
features.Resources_: Wintering waterfowl, Fort Clatsop National Park, foraging shorebirds and seabirds.
features.Staging_Ar: Port of Astoria, Pier 2.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the lake.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from a ramp at the Beacon Rock State Park or Skamania Landing.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of lake.
features.Resources_: National wildlife refuge; wildlife and waterfowl concentrations in winter, juvenile salmon rearing area, bald eagle nesting.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the mouth of the creeks.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from a ramp at the Beacon Rock State Park or Skamania Landing.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creeks.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting; salmonid concentrations and habitat (peak times are May - June,  Oct - Dec).

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from each end of the bridge on Hwy alt 102 in a chevron configuration and collect at the apex with a skimmer.  This strategy may be difficult or impossible to deploy if the current is too strong.
features.Site_Acces: Access by boat from launch at Yacht  Club near bridge or at Tides Point across from Daggett Point.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of River.
features.Resources_: Wild and hatchery Salmon (Clatsop County Fish Pens) Great Blue Heron rookery, marina fisheries, shorebird and seabird foraging area, sturgeon, sensitive nesting species, waterfowl and crustaceans.
features.Staging_Ar: Port of Astoria, Pier 2.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a double chevron configuration to surround each pen.
features.Site_Acces: Access by boat from launch at Yacht  Club near bridge or at Tides Point across from Daggett Point
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Pens.

features.Staging_Ar: Port of Astoria, Pier 2.

features.Strategy_I: Place boom across slough entrance.  May be a tide gate, deploy boom if gate leaks or cannot be closed.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of slough.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the river just south of the mouth of the Wallooskee River.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of River.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the river on the downstream side of the bridge at Highway 202 at an angle to collect on the north side.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the mouth of the creek.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from a ramp at the Beacon Rock State Park.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the slough/ creek.

features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Beacon Rock State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom between Pierce and Ives Islands at the narrowest point (if not feasible, not a priority).

features.Location: Channel between Ives and Pierce Islands (WA)                    45-37.270'N 121-59.885'W
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Exclusion - Keep oil in the main channel and out of north channel.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat, mixed sport fishery, sturgeon spawning, waterfowl.

features.Strategy_I: Boom off entrance to Hamilton Creek.  Minimize disturbance of shoreline and back-beach areas around creek mouth.  Use established roads only for vehicle access.

features.Resources_: Important nesting area; endangered plant species (Rorippa) along the northern shoreline.  Sensitive shoreline and back-beach.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Beacon Rock State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom between Ives and Hamilton Islands at the narrowest point (if not feasible, not a priority).  Minimize disturbance of shoreline and back-beach areas.  Use established roads only for vehicle access.

features.Location: Channel between Ives and Hamilton Islands (WA)                    45-37.565'N 121-59.155'W
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Exclusion - Keep oil in the main channel and out of north channel.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat, mixed sport fishery, sturgeon spawning, waterfowl.  Sensitive shoreline and back-beach.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom around the net pens and pier at the north end of the USCG Station on Tongue Point.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the net pens.

features.Staging_Ar: Tongue Point USCG Station.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration around the RR trestle so as not to interfere with swinging bridge.  Railroad track is operational, could bring in railcar for oil storage.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl, other sensitive nesting species, wetlands, year-round.
features.Staging_Ar: Tongue Point USCG Station.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in front of the railroad trestle, located about 2.3 miles east of the John Day River.  Lay sorbents around interior of marshy areas.  Possible to pump oil onto a railcar.
features.Site_Acces: Access via boat or railcar
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh and creek
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, year-round.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in front of the railroad trestle, at the mouth of the creek.  Possible to pump oil onto a railcar.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creek

features.Strategy_I: Close off creek mouth.  Difficult to protect marsh at mouth due to low water.  Possible to boom further upstream, but does not protect the desired habitat.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access only.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Protect marsh of Brix Bay.
features.Resources_: Jan-Aug sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Tongue Point USCG Station.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at angle across mouth of river to road on west side for possible collection - pilings slightly upriver (500'), will not be able to protect marsh near mouth.
features.Site_Acces: Boat launch = Hwy 4 E., turn right on Oneida Rd just before Deep River bridge, 2.1 miles to launch. Harry Larson has key to launch (1st house on right on way out from launch).
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat (peak numbers in Feb-July, and Sept-Dec).
features.Staging_Ar: Tongue Point USCG Station, or from boat launch parking lot.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the creek mouth at the bridge.  Only winds from the SW would drive oil into the creek mouth.
features.Site_Acces: Road access on  Altoona - Pillar Rock Rd (403): take to where it crosses Crooked Creek.  Grays Bay is too shallow for access from Columbia River.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creek and wetlands.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat; wetlands.
features.Staging_Ar: Hwy 4 E., right on Altoona - Pillar Rock Rd. (403), take a right just before bridge for boat launch and parking lot.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle across the river near Oneida or at the bend of Devils Elbow, depending on access.  Minimize disturbance of shoreline and back-beach areas.  Use established roads only for vehicle access.
features.Site_Acces: Boat launch on Grays river, too shallow to come in from Grays Bay.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering river.
features.Resources_: Sensitive shoreline and back-beach, salmonid concentrations and habitat (peak numbers in Feb-July, and Sept-Dec).
features.Staging_Ar: Hwy 4 E., right on Altoona - Pillar Rock Rd. take a right just before bridge for boat launch and parking lot.

features.Strategy_I: Angle off piling at E. end of island to deflect oil into main channel.  Sand bar east of Miller Sands Island makes lagoon inaccessible.  Other than the main channel, the water around Island is very shallow.
features.Site_Acces: Tongue Point USCG Station.
features.Response_S: Deflection - Protect lagoon and island.
features.Resources_: Lagoon - high primary productivity, juvenile fish foraging, waterfowl concentration, sensitive nesting species, goose brooding,  year-round.
features.Staging_Ar: Tongue Point USCG Station.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across breach in dike.
features.Site_Acces: Access from water only.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Protect wetlands behind dike, south of Karlson Island.
features.Resources_: Freshwater marsh, waterfowl concentration, sensitive nesting area (F,W, Spr).  Highly vegetated underwater with high tides.
features.Staging_Ar: Tongue Point USCG Station or old ferry dock at Knappa.

features.Strategy_I: Close off mouth of creek.  Good structured sides along either bank.
features.Site_Acces: Access from water, or road access from town of Knappa.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of creek.
features.Resources_: Salmonid concentrations and habitat, wetlands.  Protection required year-round.

features.Strategy_I: Close off entrance to slough.  Requires shallow draft skiff.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of slough.

features.Strategy_I: Close off entrance to slough.  Requires shallow draft skiff.  Grizzly Slough is up Blind Slough which is too large to boom off.  Anchor to trees on either side.

features.Strategy_I: Close off mouth of river.  Tide gates over Wallacut R. on Stringtown Rd. may act as barrier to oil.  Minimize disturbance of shoreline and back-beach areas around river mouth.  Use established roads only for vehicle access.

features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of river.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the slough on the northwest corner of Welch Island.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the mouth just before the junction of the creek and slough in a chevron configuration, from the seawall on the E. side to the pilling on the W. side.  Use if oil is diverted into Steamboat Slough  (LCR-35.1).  Watch for boat traffic.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the middle entrance to the slough.  Relatively slow current (1-1.5 knots) in slough.  Log rafts may be present in this area.

features.Resources_: Shrub/Scrub on both shores, wetland habitat, Columbia Whitetail deer habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: USFWS barn just north of site.  Cathlamet Marina offers fuel and food.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from the SW shore of Tenasillahe Island for collection of oil that enters the channel; poor access requires portable skimmers.  Boom needs to be tended, current is 2-4 knots, strong winds.  Log rafts may be present in this area.

features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Prevent oil from continuing downstream.
features.Resources_: Emergent wetlands.  Downriver is extremely sensitive from this point.
features.Staging_Ar: USFWS barn just north of site.  Cathlamet Marina offers fuel and food.

features.Resources_: Tidal marshes, waterfowl concentrations, and sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Barnum Road or the private road out to the end of the sand spit, or from Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from the beach on the south end of the sand spit leading to Polnell Point to the northeast to collect oil moving along the beach from the east.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Oak Harbor Marina, or Everett.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Torpedo Road to Midway Road.  Access to the point is through a locked gate, contact the Whidbey Island Naval Air Station at 360-257-4330 for entry.
features.Location: Polnell Point (East side of Crescent Harbor, east side of Whidbey Island)  ISL0247
features.Response_S: Collection - Prevent oil from moving down Saratoga Passage.
features.Resources_: Sensitive nesting species, waterfowl concentrations, other Saratoga Passage resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the road to Polnell Point, or from the Oak Harbor Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration from the beach at the entrance to Maylor's Marsh.  Tidal currents through the entrance of the marsh can be very strong.  Anchor chevron apex far enough off shore so oil is not entrained under the boom by tidal curre
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Oak Harbor Marina, or Everett.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Pioneer Way to West Coral Sea Ave. to Cascade Drive.  Site is on the Naval Seaplane Base, contact the Whidbey Island Naval Air Station at 360-257-4330 for entry.
features.Location: Maylor's Marsh (South side of Oak Harbor, east side of Whidbey Island)  ISL0222
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of marsh.
features.Resources_: Marsh habitat, sensitive nesting species, waterfowl concentrations.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Oak Harbor Marina, or Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the lagoon.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Oak Harbor Marina, or Everett.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Harrington Road through private property at the beach.
features.Location: Race Lagoon (East side of Whidbey Island, just south of Penn Cove) ISL0151
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the Lagoon.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Oak Harbor Marina, or Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration across the entrance to the bay and the cove from the south side of Rosario Head to the northwest corner of Reservation Head.  Run the boom between Gull Rocks and Coffin Rocks.  This area is exposed to southerly and
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp in Bowman Bay (SKA0472), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Rosario Road.
features.Location: Bowman Bay and Sharpe Cove  (Northwest of Deception Pass) SKA0469
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the bay and cove.
features.Resources_: Protect rocky shoreline and kelp beds, seabird concentrations, and  sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Bowman Bay boat ramp parking lot, the Deception Pass State Park, or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Based on trajectories, deploy boom to protect as much of the shoreline in the harbor as possible that is expected to be impacted.  All beaches in the harbor have high resource value.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp at the Freeland County Park, or Everett.  Vehicle access from the Mukilteo Ferry to Highway 525 to Freeland, or from Anacortes on Highway 20 to Highway 525.
features.Location: Holmes Harbor (Southeast side of Whidbey Island) - General strategy for the entire harbor.
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Deflection/ Collection - Protect beaches throughout the harbor.
features.Resources_: All beaches in the area are baitfish spawning habitat.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Freeland County Park (ISL0095), or Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the tidal marsh.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Camano Island State Park boat ramp (ISL0677), or Everett.  Vehicle access from I-5 to Highway 532 to East Camano Drive to Elger Bay Road.
features.Location: Elger Bay (Southwest side of Camano Island) ISL0682
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the tidal marsh behind the sand spit.
features.Resources_: Tidal marshes, waterfowl concentrations, and sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the parking lot at the Camano Island State Park boat ramp (ISL0677), or Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron configuration from the tip of Hermosa Point south to the opposite point northwest of Mission Beach.  In poor weather, move the boom inside to protect the bay south of the sand spit across the middle of the bay, running the boom f
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the marina in Tulalip Bay, or Everett.  Vehicle access from I-5 to Tulalip Road.
features.Location: Tulalip Bay (Just north of Everett) SNO0086
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the bay.
features.Resources_: Seabird and waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species, and fish resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the marina in Tulalip Bay, or from Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the slough downstream from the Highway 529 bridge, from the south shore angled north and east to the north shore near the bridge for collection.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Everett.  Vehicle access from I-5 to Highway 529.
features.Location: Ebey Slough (above I-5, between Everett and Marysville) SNO0114
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Collection - Keep oil out of the slough.
features.Resources_: Seabird and waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage off Highway 529 on the northwest side of the bridge, or from Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom west of the confluence of the two sloughs.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Everett.  Vehicle access from I-5 to Highway 529.
features.Location: Steamboat and Union Sloughs (at confluence, between Everett and Marysville) SNO0131
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the sloughs.
features.Resources_: Seabird and waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage off Highway 529 at the west tip of Spencer Island, or from Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the river mouth from Preston Point across the river to Smith Island.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Everett.  Vehicle access from I-5 to Highway 529 South to West Marine View Drive.
features.Location: Snohomish River (at mouth in Everett) SNO0162
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the mouth of the river.
features.Resources_: Seabird and waterfowl concentrations, sensitive nesting species.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Preston Point, or Everett.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the west entrance to the bay from the west shore to the dock on the west end of Ben Ure Island.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp in Cornet Bay (ISL0305), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Cornet Bay Road.
features.Location: Cornet Bay - West entrance (West shore to Ben Ure Island, north end of Whidbey Island) SKA0311
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the bay.
features.Resources_: State Park recreational resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Cornet Bay boat ramp parking lot, the Deception Pass State Park, or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the east entrance to the bay from the east end of Ben Ure Island to the pier at the Cornet Bay boat ramp for collection with a vac truck at the boat ramp.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp in Cornet Bay (ISL0305), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Cornet Bay Road.
features.Location: Cornet Bay - East entrance (Ben Ure Island to the east shore, north end of Whidbey Island) SKA0317
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Collection - Keep oil out of the bay.
features.Resources_: State Park recreational resources.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Cornet Bay boat ramp parking lot, the Deception Pass State Park, or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle to the south from the beach at Gibraltar to collect oil moving along the shoreline from Deception Pass.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp in Cornet Bay (ISL0305), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Gibraltar Road.
features.Location: Gibraltar (West side of Similk Bay) SKA0494
features.Response_S: Collection - Keep oil out of Similk Bay.
features.Resources_: Dungeness crab, large waterfowl concentration, eagle nests, high productivity area.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the Deception Pass State Park, Cornet Bay, or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the outer entrance to the bay from the point on the west shore to the base of the sand spit on the east shore.  May be difficult to deploy at low tide, much of the area becomes a mud flat.  Deploy NC-7 first at low tide.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp in Cornet Bay (ISL0305), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Reservation  Road.
features.Location: Turner Bay - Outer Strategy (Northeast corner of Similk Bay) SKA0510
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the bay.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the road on the west shore (SKA0506), the Swinomish Channel boat ramp parking lot (under Highway 20), or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the inner entrance to the bay from the tip of the sand spit on the east shore to the beach on the west shore.  Deploy before NC-6 at low tide.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the ramp in Cornet Bay (ISL0305), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to Reservation  Road.
features.Location: Turner Bay - Inner Strategy (Northeast corner of Similk Bay) SKA0512
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the bay.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the road on the west shore (SKA0506), the Swinomish Channel boat ramp parking lot (under Highway 20), or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy 500' of boom at the small pocket on the west shore of the channel south of the Highway 20 bridge to deflect the oil into a natural collection area.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Swinomish Channel ramp.  Vehicle access from I-5 to Highway 20, go west and exit at the Swinomish Casino, turn back east to a dike road on the west side of the channel (SKA0349).  Vac truck access from the dike road.
features.Location: Pocket on west side of Swinomish Channel SKA0596
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Keep oil from moving into the Swinomish Channel.
features.Resources_: Wetland habitat; waterfowl and shorebirds.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at the Swinomish Channel boat ramp parking lot (under Highway 20).

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom across the entrance to the sloughs to protect the tidal marsh at the entrance.  Connection to the sloughs is through culverts or tide gates inside the marsh area.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from the Swinomish Channel boat ramp (SKA0595), or from Anacortes.  Vehicle access from Highway 20 to the east dike road.
features.Location: Swinomish Channel (East side, connection to Higgins Slough and the south end of Telegraph Slough)  SKA0599
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of the entrance to the sloughs.
features.Resources_: Waterfowl concentrations.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from the dike road on the east shore of the Swinomish Cannel, the Swinomish Channel boat ramp parking lot (under Highway 20), or Anacortes.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle out from the Blaine small boat harbor breakwater to collect oil moving along the shore from the south.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Blaine or Semiahmoo Marina.  Vehicle access from I-5 exit 276, go west on Marine Drive to marina, vac truck access on end of breakwater.
features.Response_S: Collection - keep oil off shoreline
features.Resources_: Extensive bird habitat (diving ducks, cormorants, loons), eelgrass, sand lance larvae spawning, herring and smelt spawning.  Cancer crab, clam beds and seal haulouts.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at Blaine Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle out from beach at state park boat ramp to collect oil moving around Pt. Whitehorn past NPS-11.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Birch Bay Village Marina or ramp at state park.  Vehicle access from I-5 exits 266 or 270, go west to Birch Bay Drive, vac truck assess at boat ramp, off Birch Bay Drive.
features.Response_S: Collection - Keep oil out of inner Birch Bay.
features.Resources_: State park, archeological sites, eelgrass, and herring spawning and major waterfowl site.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at Birch Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle out from beach to deflect oil moving around Pt. Whitehorn into bay.  If possible, set up skimmer at end of boom to collect.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Birch Bay Village Marina.  No vehicle access.
features.Response_S: Diversion - Divert oil out into deeper water for collection at NPS-9 and       NPS-10.
features.Resources_: State park, archeological sites, eelgrass, and herring spawning and major waterfowl site.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at Birch Bay State Park.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach outward at an angle to collect oil moving along beach, primarily for oil from the south.  Area subject to extreme adverse weather that may prevent deployment of boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP pier.  Vac truck access to beach at boat ramp at base of pier.
features.Location: Cherry Point, at the BP Pier WHA0161
features.Response_S: Collection - Prevent oil from moving up beach.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at BP pier.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach outward at an angle to collect oil moving along beach.  Area is a natural collection point, primarily for oil from the south.  Area subject to extreme adverse weather that may prevent deployment of boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers.  Vehicle access from I-5 exit 266, go west on Grandview Road to Kickerville Road, go south to Alder Grove Road, go west to Powder Plant Road, and south to Gulf Road,vac truck access to beach from Gulf Road.
features.Response_S: Collection - Prevent oil from moving up beach.
features.Resources_: Herring Spawning area, sandlance larvae, smelt spawning and eelgrass.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at BP or Tosco piers.

features.Strategy_I: If winds are from the east or south, deploy boom in three 1000' overlapping legs 100-200' apart to deflect oil out into open water for collection with skimmers.  If winds are from the west or northwest, deploy 1000' of boom at an angle to collect oil mov
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers, or from Bellingham or Sandy Point Marina.  Vehicle access from I-5 exit 260, go west on Slater Road, vac truck access to beach from South Beach Way.
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Deflect oil out into open water or collect on beach.
features.Resources_: Archeology, eelgrass, herring spawning, sand lance larvae
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at BP or Tosco piers.

features.Strategy_I: If winds are from the east or south, deploy boom in three 1000' overlapping legs 100-200' apart to deflect oil out into open water for collection with skimmers.  If winds are from the west or northwest, deploy 1000' of boom at an angle to collect oil mov
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers, or from Bellingham or Sandy Point Marina.  Vehicle access from I-5 exit 260, go west on Slater Road, vac truck access to beach from South Beach Way.
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Deflect oil out into open water or collect on beach.
features.Resources_: Archeology, eelgrass, herring spawning, sand lance larvae
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at BP or Tosco piers.

features.Strategy_I: If winds are from the east or south, deploy boom in three 1000' overlapping legs 100-200' apart to deflect oil out into open water for collection with skimmers.  If winds are from the west or northwest, deploy 1000' of boom at an angle to collect oil mov
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers, or from Bellingham or Sandy Point Marina.  Vehicle access from I-5 exit 260, go west on Slater Road, vac truck access to beach from South Beach Way.
features.Response_S: Deflection/ Collection - Deflect oil out into open water or collect on beach.
features.Resources_: Archeology, eelgrass, herring spawning, sand lance larvae
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at BP or Tosco piers.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from north shore of Sandy Point Shores Marina entrance out into straits and anchor to deflect oil into open water for collection with skimmers.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers, or from Bellingham or Sandy Point Marina.  No vehicle access.
features.Response_S: Deflection - Deflect oil out into open water.
features.Resources_: Marina, marsh, eelgrass, waterfowl, herring spawning, sand lance larvae, cancer crab
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at BP or Tosco piers, or at Sandy Point Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from Sandy Point to the seapond dike in Lummi Bay and anchor well.  Area is shallow and becomes a mudflat at low tide.  Strong winds may prevent deployment of boom.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers, or from Bellingham, Anacortes, or Sandy Point Marina.  Vehicle access to seapond dike road from Haxton Way.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering north bay.
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, waterfowl, shorebirds, aquaculture, clam and oyster beds, cancer crabs and herring spawning.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at Tosco or BP Pier at Cherry Point or CSCI moorage in Anacortes or Bellingham.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from seapond dike to shoreline to the south.  Area is shallow and becomes a mudflat at low tide.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from BP or Tosco piers, or from Bellingham, Anacortes, or Sandy Point Marina.  Vehicle access to seapond dike road from Haxton Way.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering east bay.
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, waterfowl, shorebirds, aquaculture, clam and oyster beds, cancer crabs and herring spawning.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at Tosco or BP Pier at Cherry Point or CSCI moorage in Anacortes or Bellingham.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach west of Lummi ferry terminal.  If oil is from the north, use as diversion.  If oil is from the south, use as collection.  Notify Lummi Ferry terminal.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes. Vehicle access, from I-5 exit 260, take Slater Road west to Haxton Way to ferry terminal.
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Keep oil from moving up or down Hale Passage
features.Resources_: Eelgrass beds, herring spawning, seabirds, archeology sites, clam beds
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from Portage Point to Portage Island on the Hale Passage side of Portage Spit in a chevron formation.  Water flow across the spit is primarily from Portage Bay to Hale Passage.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes. Vehicle access, from I-5 exit 260, take Slater Road west to Haxton Way to Lummi View Drive.
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Portage Bay
features.Resources_: Shellfish, clambeds, herring spawning grounds, Western Grebe, waterfowl and shorebird concentrations and eelgrass.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in a chevron formation out from the point next to the Semiahmoo Marina across to the Blaine small boat harbor breakwater.  Collect at each end.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Blaine or Semiahmoo Marina.  Vac truck access on either side.
features.Response_S: Exclusion/ Diversion/ Collection - keep oil out of Drayton Harbor
features.Resources_: Extensive bird habitat (diving ducks, cormorants, loons), eelgrass, sand lance larvae spawning, herring and smelt spawning.  Cancer crab, clam beds and seal haulouts.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at Blaine or Semiahmoo Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle out from the southwest corner of Portage Island to deflect the oil out into Hale Passage.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes.  No vehicle access.
features.Location: Point Francis (Southwest corner of Portage Island) WHA0359
features.Response_S: Diversion - Keep oil from moving up or down Hale Passage
features.Resources_: Eelgrass beds, herring spawning, clam beds, cancer crabs.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or Bellingham Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in chevron configuration from Hermosa Beach to Brant Island.  Can collect with a vac truck at Hermosa Beach from Lummi Shore Road.  Area is shallow and becomes a mudflat at low tide.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes. Vehicle access, from I-5 exit 260, take Slater Road west to Haxton Way to Lummi Shore Drive.
features.Location: Portage Bay, (Hermosa Beach to Brant Island) WHA0368
features.Response_S: Exclusion /Collection - Prevent oil from entering Portage Bay.
features.Resources_: Shellfish, clam beds, herring spawning grounds, western grebe, waterfowl & shorebird conc., eelgrass
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or Bellingham Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom in chevron configuration from Brant Island to Brant Point.  Area is shallow and becomes a mudflat at low tide.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes. Vehicle access, from I-5 exit 260, take Slater Road west to Haxton Way to Lummi Shore Drive.
features.Location: Portage Bay, (Brant Island to Brant Point) WHA0368
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Prevent oil from entering Portage Bay.
features.Resources_: Shellfish, clam beds, herring spawning grounds, western grebe, waterfowl & shorebird conc., eelgrass
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or Bellingham Marina.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from Lovers Bluff to north shoreline of Legoe Bay.  Deploy only if oil is coming from the south and outer Legoe Bay is being used to collect oil from the Village Point strategy.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Sandy Point Marina, Bellingham or Anacortes. Vehicle access by taking Lummi Island ferry and driving to Village Point on Legoe Bay Road.
features.Location: Legoe Bay (West side of Lummi Island) WHA0253
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Legoe Bay.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Sandy Point Marina or Lummi Island ferry terminal.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach on Village Point out into straits and anchor. Boom could be tended with a vessel at tide changes to reposition angles.  Oil can be collected from either direction.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Sandy Point Marina, Bellingham or Anacortes. Vehicle access by taking Lummi Island ferry and driving to Village Point on Legoe Bay Road.
features.Location: Village Point (West side of Lummi Island) WHA0248
features.Response_S: Collection - Keep oil from moving further up or down the straits.
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, herring spawning, sand lance larvae
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Sandy Point Marina or Lummi Island ferry terminal.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach on Point Megley out into straits and anchor. Boom could be tended with a vessel at tide changes to reposition angles.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Sandy Point Marina, Bellingham, or Anacortes.  No vehicle access.
features.Location: Point Megley (North tip of Lummi Island) WHA0238
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Deflection - Keep oil off point and deflect oil back into open water.
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, herring spawning, clam beds, seabirds, Murrelets, Pigeon Guilliomonts and Grebes.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage from Sandy Point Marina or Lummi Island ferry terminal.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach on Lummi Point out into Hale Passage and anchor. Boom could be tended with a vessel at tide changes to reposition angles.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes.  Vehicle access by taking Lummi Island ferry and driving north on Nugent Road.
features.Location: Lummi Point (East side of Lummi Island) WHA0231
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Keep oil from moving up or down Hale Passage.
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, herring spawning, clam beds, cancer crab, seabirds, murrelets, pigeon guillemots and grebes.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or at ferry terminal on Lummi Island.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach south of the ferry terminal out into Hale Passage and anchor. Boom could be tended with a vessel at tide changes to reposition angles.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes, vehicle access by ferry.
features.Location: Lummi Island Ferry (Lummi Island side) WHA0338
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Keep oil from moving up or down Hale Passage
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, herring spawning, clam beds, cancer crab, seabirds, murrelets, pigeon guillemots and grebes.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or at ferry terminal on Lummi Island.

features.Strategy_I: Secure boom to shore at an angle across bay.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes.  Vehicle access by taking Lummi Island ferry and driving south on Nugent Road and east on Sunrise Road.  Beach access through private property.
features.Location: Sunrise Cove (East side of Lummi Island) WHA0329
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Sunrise Cove.
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, clambeds and herring spawning grounds, Geoducks.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or at ferry terminal on Lummi Island.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach on Echo Point out into Hale Passage and anchor. Boom could be tended with a vessel at tide changes to reposition angles.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes.  Vehicle access by taking Lummi Island ferry and driving south on Nugent Road and east on Sunrise Road.  Beach access through private property.
features.Location: Echo Point (East side of Lummi Island) WHA0328
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Keep oil from moving up or down Hale Passage
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, herring spawning, clam beds, cancer crab, seabirds, murrelets, pigeon guillemots and grebes.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or at ferry terminal on Lummi Island.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom at an angle across the creek on the east side of the bridge on Blaine Road.  A small workboat will be needed to place the boom.
features.Site_Acces: Boat access from Blaine or Semiahmoo Marina.  Vehicle access from I-5 exit 274, go east on Blaine Road to site.

features.Resources_: Archeological Site, eelgrass, herring spawning, salmonids, cancer crabs, shorebirds and seabirds.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage along the side of the road at the bridge.

features.Strategy_I: Deploy boom from beach and pilings at gravel pit out into Hale Passage and anchor. Boom could be tended with a vessel at tide changes to reposition angles.
features.Site_Acces: By boat from Bellingham or Anacortes.  Vehicle access by taking Lummi Island ferry and driving south on Nugent Road, east on Sunrise Road, and south on Seacrest Road.  Beach access through private property.
features.Response_S: Diversion/ Collection - Keep oil from moving up or down Hale Passage
features.Resources_: Eelgrass, herring spawning, clam beds, cancer crab, seabirds, murrelets, pigeon guillemots and grebes.
features.Staging_Ar: Stage at ferry terminal at Gooseberry Point, or at ferry terminal on Lummi Island.

features.Strategy_I: Secure boom to shore across cove south of gravel pit.

features.Location: Smugglers Cove (East side of Lummi Island) WHA0317
features.Response_S: Exclusion - Keep oil out of Smugglers Cove.
